history.content:
Interested in Augmented Reality? Want to learn Unity? Looking for some extra units?

Apply to the Extended Reality Development DeCal!

(For spring 2021, we will be building AR applications)

 

Similar to how mobile devices revolutionized the way we interact with our electronic devices, Virtual Reality and Augmented Reality represent another exciting paradigm shift in human computer interaction. XR stands for Extended Reality, which is the realm that encompasses both Virtual and Augmented Reality.

This semester, the course will teach students to develop mobile AR applications using Unity. Students will get exposure to different kinds of VR/AR apps and work in teams to build their own from scratch. The course is designed for beginners with no prior VR/AR experience required! After completion of the course, we welcome interested students to join an existing project team with XR@Berkeley or pitch their own project.

 

This 3-unit course will be held on Thursday’s, 2:00 - 4:00 PM (PST) online (Zoom) with live attendance optional.

 

Apply by February 2nd @ 11:59 PM (PST)!

 

Learn more about the DeCal:

XR@B Infosessions: Details TBD

DeCal Expo (1/24): Details TBD

 

Feel free to browse the course website linked below and contact decal@xr.berkeley.edu with any questions or concerns!

 

Important Links:

Application: https://tinyurl.com/xr-apply

Official DeCal Listing: https://decal.berkeley.edu/courses/5461

XR DeCal Website: https://xr.berkeley.edu/decal/
history.subject: Extended Reality Development DeCal applications are open for Spring 2021!
